title: Fix broken Careers navigation link on the main page

requirements.text: Fix the 'Careers' navigation link in the Header component (frontend/src/components/Header.tsx) so that clicking it navigates to the /careers route. Inspect the current click handler or href for the Careers nav item and ensure it uses the router's navigation (e.g., router.navigate or an <a href='/careers'> / Link to='/careers') consistently with how the Resources page link is implemented. Apply the fix to both the desktop nav and the mobile hamburger menu.

quotes: when i click on the word careers in the main page, nothing happens

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking 'Careers' in the desktop navigation bar navigates the user to the /careers page.
Clicking 'Careers' in the mobile hamburger menu navigates the user to the /careers page.
The Careers link behavior is consistent with how the Resources link is implemented in the Header.
No other navigation links or page functionality are broken by this change.

constraints: Do not modify any immutable frontend paths (useInternetIdentity, useActor, main.tsx, ui components).
Do not alter the CareersPage content or its JSON-LD structured data.
nonGoals: Changing the content or layout of the Careers page itself.
Modifying any other navigation links beyond the Careers entry.
